{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3332455,"name":"Ariel Schwarzbaum","username":"MrPotato4991","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/mrpotato4991/{size}/200949_2.png","created_at":"2024-03-13T22:14:21.816Z","cooked":"

What apps does your team use for media-related stuff?

Do you use Adobe’s apps?
If so, do you pay for them? Are you getting sponsored for them?

Our Media and graphic design teams do tons of work all year long, we use 2-4 PCs on a typical build season day (you can check us out on YouTube and see how much we upload).
Up until now we’ve been using cracked Adobe apps (Premiere, Lightroom, Photoshop, After Effects, Illustrator) but now we’re having problems with some of them…

Do you know of any possible solutions that can help us?
Thanks a lot!

","post_number":1,"post_type":1,"posts_count":13,"updated_at":"2024-03-13T22:14:21.816Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":129,"reads":171,"readers_count":170,"score":679.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":458588,"topic_slug":"creative-apps-for-media-team","display_username":"Ariel Schwarzbaum","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":51132,"hidden":false,"trust_level":1,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Ariel Schwarzbaum"},"post_url":"/t/creative-apps-for-media-team/458588/1","custom_user_title":"Ariel Schwarzbaum","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null,"can_vote":false},{"id":3332458,"name":"Aaron Huang","username":"AaronHuang","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/a/779978/{size}.png","created_at":"2024-03-13T22:21:51.793Z","cooked":"

Is discussion of piracy allowed here?

","post_number":2,"post_type":1,"posts_count":13,"updated_at":"2024-03-13T22:21:51.793Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":1,"reads":157,"readers_count":156,"score":41.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":458588,"topic_slug":"creative-apps-for-media-team","display_username":"Aaron Huang","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":53779,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Some random"},"post_url":"/t/creative-apps-for-media-team/458588/2","custom_user_title":"Some random","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3332460,"name":"Alex Lu","username":"ChickenMan","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/chickenman/{size}/195779_2.png","created_at":"2024-03-13T22:23:02.337Z","cooked":"

Our team uses the entire Adobe suite powered by our schools’ licenses. The exact ones you’ve mentioned actually, I’d avoid the cracked copies…

Premiere, the best substitute is Davinci Resolve, I’d argue it’s even better, and it’s free! For the normal license which should have everything you need.

Inkscape is fantastic for an illustrator alternative

Gimp and adobe express aren’t bad free alternatives to Photoshop

The default Mac Photos are surprisingly alright, but DarkTable is also great for a lightroom alternative.

Can’t comment on alternatives for Aftereffects

That’s pretty much a flat NO.

See the FAQ for the site:

Post Only Your Own Stuff
You may not post anything digital that belongs to someone else without permission. You may not post descriptions of, links to, or methods for stealing someone’s intellectual property (software, video, audio, images), or for breaking any other law.

We use Adobe software that we get access to through the school district. Fortunately, we have a good working relationship with the Computer Graphics Teacher, so we’re able to get the CTE access approved from him for any team members who would like to use the software.

","post_number":5,"post_type":1,"posts_count":13,"updated_at":"2024-03-13T23:44:57.604Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":2,"reads":112,"readers_count":111,"score":47.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":458588,"topic_slug":"creative-apps-for-media-team","display_username":"Jack Somers","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":57984,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Tom Nader Fanboy"},"post_url":"/t/creative-apps-for-media-team/458588/5","custom_user_title":"Tom Nader Fanboy","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3332561,"name":"","username":"four","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/four/{size}/199902_2.png","created_at":"2024-03-14T00:45:25.632Z","cooked":"

I generally use open source software for this kind of stuff.

  • Blender
  • Kdenlive
  • Inkscape
  • GIMP
  • Krita
  • VLC

Some of our people like Canva for graphic design stuff.

For sticker designs (if that counts as media), I primarily use Krita if I’m at home with access to my laptop and tablet, or if we want a design made the day of something happening while at a competition, like knocking over a ref stand for example, I use IbisPaint X on my phone

This is fantastic, amazed at the quality. I think last year y’all also had a reveal that was released ,after in the season and it was also fantastic in its shots.

","post_number":9,"post_type":1,"posts_count":13,"updated_at":"2024-03-14T02:08:46.274Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":7,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":71,"readers_count":70,"score":14.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":458588,"topic_slug":"creative-apps-for-media-team","display_username":"Alex Lu","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":3,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"reply_to_user":{"id":29320,"username":"celttechie","name":"Question all assumptions, search for truth.","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/c/7feea3/{size}.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":59641,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/creative-apps-for-media-team/458588/9","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3332625,"name":"Tyler Olds","username":"Tyler_Olds","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/tyler_olds/{size}/231610_2.png","created_at":"2024-03-14T02:12:00.881Z","cooked":"

I highly recommend Davinci Resolve if a paid app like Premiere is not something you are able to or willing to pay for. It’s a very capable software and as mentioned free!

Adobe Creative Cloud is discounted for students and educators to $19.99/month and I believe you can have 2 accounts logged in at any given time. Even with 4 people you may be able to convince your team to invest the $500/year for licenses to professional software.

I’m surprised nobody has mentioned Affinity Design & Photo. It’s cheap, full featured, supports macOS, and a one time cost. It also has identical key bindings/similar UI to Adobe so it’s a stupid easy transition.

","post_number":11,"post_type":1,"posts_count":13,"updated_at":"2024-03-14T02:15:14.614Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":65,"readers_count":64,"score":48.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":458588,"topic_slug":"creative-apps-for-media-team","display_username":"Dalton","primary_group_name":"CTRE","flair_name":"CTRE","flair_url":"/uploads/default/original/3X/1/b/1bd2b430e1bb6427d1c6504ff6abcd31de851a6d.png","flair_bg_color":"","flair_color":"","flair_group_id":57,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":2}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":61981,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"CTR Electronics"},"post_url":"/t/creative-apps-for-media-team/458588/11","custom_user_title":"CTR Electronics","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":2}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":2,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3332667,"name":"Matt K","username":"mk02","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/mk02/{size}/170664_2.png","created_at":"2024-03-14T03:06:44.673Z","cooked":"

If you are sorting and editing a few hundred photos or less:

  • In MacOS, Finder, Preview, and Photos work quite well.
  • Windows lacks in (useful) native photo editing features—its rather disappointing.

If you take lots of photos:

  • There are some free, open source options, like digiKam, ACDSee, and Darktable. They’re all…okay. All of them can each do a few things I need, but none of them can do everything I need. Because they’re free, I would not expect the developers to always stay on top of bugs and performance optimizations.
  • Many paid photo sorting/editing software offer subscription and perpetual options, which is nice. I use Capture One as an alternative to Lightroom, and I paid for the perpetual license when they offered a nice discount. I’m usually a volunteer photographer at events my team attends, so when I have to sort through thousands of images, the choice of software really matters. Capture One handles high volume workflows really well, as do other paid photo software like Photo Mechanic and Luminar. If your team only takes a few hundred shots a day, don’t worry about it.
daltzsmith:

I’m surprised nobody has mentioned Affinity Design & Photo. It’s cheap, full featured, supports macOS, and a one time cost.

These two purchases become a lot more compelling when you aren’t a student whose school/university doesn’t already pay for the Adobe suite. I personally switched to Affinity because I was tired of Adobe’s recurring costs, and I find the way they require their cloud integration to be installed alongside any of their apps quite annoying.

It’s also worth mentioning I still consider Adobe the leader in creative software apps. They will probably always have a leg up over everyone else with features and usability. I don’t need cutting edge AI features in Photoshop though, so I’m willing to make this tradeoff.
